meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten food revolted me.
meanings.sent2: She revolted at the sight of the creepy crawly bug.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating snails revolted her, but she tried them anyway.
meanings.sent4: The gruesome scene in the horror movie revolted the audience.
meanings.sent5: The putrid odor from the garbage can revolted everyone in the room.

meanings.sent1: The citizens revolted against the unjust ruler.
meanings.sent2: The oppressed people revolted for their freedom.
meanings.sent3: The students revolted against the strict dress code by wearing colorful socks.
meanings.sent4: The workers revolted by going on a strike for better wages.
meanings.sent5: The animals in the zoo revolted against their cages, seeking freedom.

meanings.definition: Cause to feel disgust or horror.
meanings.sent1: The graphic images in the movie revolted the audience.
meanings.sent2: The spoiled milk revolted her stomach.
meanings.sent3: The prank to put fake bugs in her bed revolted her friends.
meanings.sent4: The taste of the strange dish revolted his taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house revolted their senses.
